message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.CY 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with training an automatic modality tagger, which is a natural language processing task. Additionally, the paper mentions the use of a multi-class SVM, which is a common machine learning algorithm used in NLP. 

The paper also involves crowdsourcing for further annotation, which suggests that it could also belong to the sub-category of cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction). 

The use of machine learning algorithms and data gathering techniques also suggests that this paper could belong to the sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). 

Finally, the paper mentions the use of a rule-based modality tagger, which suggests that it could also belong to the sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as rule-based systems are commonly used in this field. 

The likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper, ordered from most to least likely, are: cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.CY.
